# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's a Julia function that accomplishes the task:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    col = lowercase(col)
    col = strip(col)
    col = replace(col, r"[^\w]", "")  # Remove non-word characters (spaces and hyphens in this case)
    col = replace(col, " ", "_")      # Replace spaces with underscores
    return col
end
```

You can use this function to clean column names as follows:

```julia
clean_column("My Column Name")
```

This will return `"my_column_name"`.
